tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
stu_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS  TEST HEAVY  GET READY TO READ
comments: You MUST read the book AND take notes. I got an A, but I worked HARD for it. The tests are tricky because 75% of the multiple choice questions have 3 possible answers, with minute details placed there specifically to trick you... and the tests are timed. You have around a minute or less to think over which answer is "most" correct in each question.

stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: Go at your own pace Everything you need to know about passing this class provided through the syllabus, and announcements via Blackboard. Book assigned for class is affordable to rent (especially the ebook) Multiple choice tests are loaded with tricks -- my tests had two short essays as well Unable to view incorrect ans, no response w/ ans

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  TOUGH GRADER  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: Prof. Gresham can be a bit disorganized, but in the end, he will make things right. The class is very straightforward. No papers, just read the chapter, complete the online Learn Smart exercises, take the chapter quiz, and repeat this process three times per unit. There are 5 units. Exams are not easy, but not difficult. I would recommend.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  TOUGH GRADER  GET READY TO READ
comments: I have major respect for this professor. When he makes a mistake he apologizes & is very fair & genuine. He always makes things right. If you do the assignments, which also are good study tools you will have a good chunk of your grade made. I found the tests to be difficult, but I learned to adjust my study habits & my scores improved. No regrets!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Mr. Gresham was very helpful during the online class. It helps if you write notes on paper rather than just typing them. He must be really busy, because he also teaches at a high school! Him and his wife are the best social studies teachers that I have ever had; I have taken them both. Highly recommend his classes. He cares about his students.

comments: Online Class. Reading and taking notes are essential. Test answers can be a bit confusing but pay close attention to choices. After you take the first one you get the hang of it. I received an A.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Took the online class, it was easy. Professor Gresham makes his requirements clear. Lots of grading opportunities, so an A is easy to achieve.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: I took this class online. The discussion board was easy, the quiz is not that bad but the exams are terrible. The class alone requires a lot of reading which is expected but what I don\'t understand is why his exams are full of tricks. The options to a question are quit similar and he chooses most of his questions from complete sentences.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Review given out only a week prior to exams. Test questions often are very hard to answer even after reading and watching the videos. Passable class. Study is a MUST.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: I took the ITV course for theserespect classes led by this instructor. ITV classes are basically "do-it-yourself" so it is hard to rate the professor. The tests basically come straight from the study guide that comes with the book. The class was very easy once I figured that out after the first test. I\'d recommend if ok with teaching yourself

comments: *DL CLASS* Super easy. I watched the videos and just used the textbook when I had to. Online testing with great review.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Took Spring 2010. Watch the videos, go to his review sessions. You get bonus points PLUS he\'ll go over every topic that is on the exam. Use the textbook if you didn\'t understand something from the videos: otherwise, its not necessary. If you DO need help, ask students... His email responses take awhile, and he\'s bombarded during review sessions.

comments: If you watch all the videos and study the review questions you\'ll do just fine.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: I absolutely hate this class, do not take ITV unless you have NOTHING ELSE to do or have ample time to dedicate to reading and videos! The study guides suck. I often feel like I have way too much info and the questions on the test barely resemble the study guide! GOVT 2305ITV is the bomb though, lol!

comments: I took his ITV class and it was super easy. He provided you with videos and as long as you actually watch them, they\'ll have all the information you need for the tests. Watch the videos and you\'ll get an A.

comments: this was a tough summer class. Only 3 test. The prof. gave a list of focus Q to answers but even then i didnt find it useful. Dont take it with any other classes. This online class really hurt my GPA!!

comments: I do not recommend this class for the summer. There is no study guide at all! You have no idea what is going to be on the test. only 11 videos, 4 chapters and 50 questions to memorize! NO REVIEW! Unless you love history.. go for it.. if not, take someone else. this summer 1 2011 ITV don\'t.I did study (clueless) dont take it!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Tough Grader (4)  Clear grading criteria (3)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (2)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Took class as ITV. There are only 3 tests so you have to study. Watch the online lesson, read the textbook and the study guide (study guide is a must). The week before the test the instructor will go over the test in the chat room and this really helps. Just print out the transcript from the chat and study it or join in on the chat.
